etymologies: Latin, from Greek Agauē, the name of one of the daughters of Cadmus in Greek mythology, from agauos ‘illustrious’

definitions: a succulent plant with rosettes of narrow spiny leaves and tall flower spikes, native to the southern US and tropical America.

notes.text: Genus Agave, family Agavaceae: numerous species, including the century plant

shortDefinitions: succulent plant with rosettes of narrow spiny leaves and tall flower spikes, native to southern US and tropical America
